item.title: Speaking Vocabulary: Movie / TV Programmes / Book
item.author: Young, YouChat
item.description: Introduction: A ~ that comes vividly to my mind is the ~ that I ~ two years ago. /ə ~ ðæt kʌmz ˈvɪvɪdli tə maɪ maɪnd ɪz ðə ~ ðæt aɪ ~ tuː jɪərz əɡoʊ/: This phrase is used when you want to talk about a specific memory or event that you remember clearly from two years ago. “A trip that comes vividly to my mind is the journey to Europe that I took two years ago.
